sections.1_story: Imagine you are looking at a picture with a missing part, like a puzzle with one piece gone. Pattern completion questions test your ability to identify which piece correctly completes the given pattern.
2_definitions: ğŸ’¡ Pattern: A repeated decorative design or sequence.
ğŸ’¡ Completion: The act of making something whole or finishing it.
ğŸ’¡ Missing Part: The section of the pattern that is not shown and needs to be identified.
ğŸ’¡ Symmetry: When one half of a pattern is a mirror image of the other.
ğŸ’¡ Rotation: Turning a pattern around a central point.
ğŸ’¡ Reflection: Flipping a pattern over a line to create a mirror image.
ğŸ’¡ Sequence: An ordered set of elements that follow a rule.
ğŸ’¡ Distractor: An option that looks similar but does not fit the pattern.
ğŸ’¡ Visual Reasoning: The ability to analyze and solve problems using visual information.
ğŸ’¡ Spatial Awareness: Understanding how shapes fit together in space.
3_formula_bank: ğŸ§® 1. Observe the given pattern carefully.
ğŸ§® 2. Identify the rule or sequence in the pattern.
ğŸ§® 3. Look for symmetry, rotation, or reflection.
ğŸ§® 4. Compare each option with the missing part.
ğŸ§® 5. Eliminate options that do not fit the pattern.
ğŸ§® 6. Check for color, shape, and orientation consistency.
ğŸ§® 7. Visualize how the missing part will look when placed.
ğŸ§® 8. Use tracing or drawing to test options if allowed.
ğŸ§® 9. Practice with different types of patterns (geometric, number, symbol, etc.).
ğŸ§® 10. Review previous year questions for common pattern types.
ğŸ§® 11. Check for repeating elements or sequences.
ğŸ§® 12. Look for unique features in the pattern.
ğŸ§® 13. Use elimination to narrow down choices.
ğŸ§® 14. Consider the position and orientation of the missing part.
ğŸ§® 15. Practice with time limits to improve speed.
4_micro_examples: A square with one corner missing.
A circle with a missing segment.
A triangle with a missing side.
A grid with one cell empty.
A star with a missing point.
A sequence of arrows with one direction missing.
A pattern of dots with one dot missing.
A checkerboard with a missing square.
A zigzag line with a missing turn.
A flower with a missing petal.

5_exam_examples.problem: Which option completes the given square pattern?
solution_steps: Observe the missing corner.
Check each option for a matching corner.
Eliminate options with incorrect orientation.
Select the option that fits perfectly.
5_exam_examples.answer: Option C completes the square pattern.

5_exam_examples.problem: Find the missing segment in the circle.
solution_steps: Look for the segment that matches the curve.
Check for color and size consistency.
Eliminate segments that do not fit.
Choose the segment that completes the circle.
5_exam_examples.answer: Option B is the correct segment.

5_exam_examples.problem: Which piece completes the checkerboard pattern?
solution_steps: Identify the missing square.
Check the color sequence.
Eliminate options with wrong color or position.
Select the correct piece.

5_exam_examples.problem: Find the missing petal in the flower pattern.
solution_steps: Count the number of petals.
Check the shape and size of each petal.
Eliminate options that do not match.
Choose the petal that fits the gap.
5_exam_examples.answer: Option A is the correct petal.

solution_steps: Observe the direction of each arrow.
Identify the sequence or pattern.
Eliminate arrows with incorrect direction.
Select the arrow that fits the sequence.
5_exam_examples.answer: Option B completes the arrow sequence.
